verses.text: Moreover Josiah kept a passover unto the \sc Lord\sc* in Jerusalem: and they killed the passover on the fourteenth \add day\add* of the first month.
And he set the priests in their charges, and encouraged them to the service of the house of the \sc Lord\sc*,

and said unto the Levites that taught all Israel, which were holy unto the \sc Lord\sc*, Put the holy ark in the house which Solomon the son of David king of Israel did build; \add it shall\add* not \add be\add* a burden upon your shoulders: serve now the \sc Lord\sc* your God, and his people Israel,
and prepare \add yourselves\add* by the houses of your fathers, after your courses, according to the writing of David king of Israel, and according to the writing of Solomon his son.
And stand in the holy \add place\add* according to the divisions of the families of the fathers of your brethren the people, and \add after\add* the division of the families of the Levites.
So kill the passover, and sanctify yourselves, and prepare your brethren, that \add they\add* may do according to the word of the \sc Lord\sc* by the hand of Moses.

And Josiah gave to the people, \add of\add* the flock, lambs and kids, all for the passover \add offerings\add*, for all that were present, to the number of thirty thousand, and three thousand bullocks: these \add were\add* of the king’s substance.

And his princes gave willingly unto the people, to the priests, and to the Levites: Hilkiah and Zechariah and Jehiel, rulers of the house of God, gave unto the priests for the passover \add offerings\add* two thousand and six hundred \add small cattle\add*, and three hundred oxen.

Conaniah also, and Shemaiah and Nethaneel, his brethren, and Hashabiah and Jeiel and Jozabad, chief of the Levites, gave unto the Levites for passover \add offerings\add* five thousand \add small cattle\add*, and five hundred oxen.
So the service was prepared, and the priests stood in their place, and the Levites in their courses, according to the king’s commandment.
And they killed the passover, and the priests sprinkled \add the blood\add* from their hands, and the Levites flayed \add them\add*.

And they removed the burnt offerings, that they might give according to the divisions of the families of the people, to offer unto the \sc Lord\sc*, as it is written in the book of Moses. And so \add did they\add* with the oxen.

And they roasted the passover with fire according to the ordinance: but the \add other\add* holy \add offerings\add* sod they in pots, and in caldrons, and in pans, and divided \add them\add* speedily among all the people.

And afterward they made ready for themselves, and for the priests: because the priests the sons of Aaron \add were busied\add* in offering of burnt offerings and the fat until night; therefore the Levites prepared for themselves, and for the priests the sons of Aaron.

And the singers the sons of Asaph \add were\add* in their place, according to the commandment of David, and Asaph, and Heman, and Jeduthun the king’s seer; and the porters \add waited\add* at every gate; they might not depart from their service; for their brethren the Levites prepared for them.
So all the service of the \sc Lord\sc* was prepared the same day, to keep the passover, and to offer burnt offerings upon the altar of the \sc Lord\sc*, according to the commandment of king Josiah.
And the children of Israel that were present kept the passover at that time, and the feast of unleavened bread seven days.

And there was no passover like to that, kept in Israel from the days of Samuel the prophet; neither did all the kings of Israel keep such a passover as Josiah kept, and the priests, and the Levites, and all Judah and Israel that were present, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
In the eighteenth year of the reign of Josiah was this passover kept.
After all this, when Josiah had prepared the temple, Necho king of Egypt came up to fight against Carchemish by Euphrates: and Josiah went out against him.

But he sent ambassadors to him, saying, What have I to do with thee, thou king of Judah? \add I come\add* not against thee \add this\add* day, but against the house wherewith I have war: for God commanded me to make haste: forbear thee from meddling with God, who \add is\add* with me, that he destroy thee not.

Nevertheless Josiah would not turn his face from him, but disguised himself, that \add he\add* might fight with him, and hearkened not unto the words of Necho from the mouth of God, and came to fight in the valley of Megiddo.
And the archers shot at king Josiah; and the king said to his servants, Have me away; for I am sore wounded.

His servants therefore took him out of \add that\add* chariot, and put him in the second chariot that he had; and they brought him \add to\add* Jerusalem, and he died, and was buried in \add one of the\add* sepulchres of his fathers. And all Judah and Jerusalem mourned for Josiah.

And Jeremiah lamented for Josiah: and all the singing \add men\add* and the singing \add women\add* spake of Josiah in their lamentations to \add this\add* day, and made them an ordinance in Israel: and behold, they \add are\add* written in the lamentations.
Now the rest of the acts of Josiah, and his goodness, according to that which was written in the law of the \sc Lord\sc*,
and his deeds, first and last, behold, they \add are\add* written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah.
